original:
Abbey National, one of the largest banks in the UK, has urged Scottish Amicable (ScotAm) to halt its demutualisation plans. The call comes after the Edinburgh-based firm announced that it was considering a conversion to a public limited company (PLC) from a mutual insurer.
In a letter to ScotAm CEO, David Pollard, Abbey National's CEO, Ian Harley, warned that the move could damage policyholders an
sampled:
Abbey National, one of the largest banks throughout the UK, has urged Scottish Amicable (ScotAm) to halt its demutualisation plans. The call comes after the Edinburgh-based firm announced that itself was considering a conversion to a public limited company (PLC) from a mutual insurer.
In a letter to ScotAm CEO, David Pollard, Abbey National's CEO, Ian Harley, warned that the move could damage policyholders an
